Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 01:28AM TeriR wrote: Deirdre, It's interesting but my father (who is still alive and well) was offered genetic testing and refused 7 years ago.  That unfortunate turn of events could have probably changed things a bit for me.  But I had excellent screening once this was known, (MRIs, mamos, physical exams - one test every 6 months), and that caught the BC really early.  So I'm lucky.  I didn't even think of asking my father to test...that was a really great suggestion you made.  However, I came to my senses today and scheduled genetic testing for tomorrow.  Yes, I am hoping the results are favorable, but I'm staying grounded in case they are not.  I've also looked into the BART test in case I have to make that decision.  I forget who said it, but this decision making phase of BC is tough.  You and all the ladies in this community have been the most supportive sounding board I could ever ask for.  I am lucky twice:  stage 0 BC and meeting all of you.  TTYL, Teri
